message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.FL, cs.CL

This paper discusses the relationship between two different approaches to describing binding structure in programming languages: nominal abstract syntax and higher-order abstract syntax. As such, it is likely to be relevant to several sub-categories of computer science on arXiv. 

Firstly, cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) is a likely category, as the paper discusses a logic programming language (alpha-Prolog) and the translation of its syntax to another logic programming language (G-). 

Secondly, cs.PL (Programming Languages) is also a likely category, as the paper is concerned with the syntax and semantics of programming languages. 

Thirdly, cs.SE (Software Engineering) is a possible category, as the paper discusses the properties of different approaches to specifying programming languages, which could be relevant to software engineering practices. 

Fourthly, cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) is a possible category, as the paper discusses the formal structure of programming language syntax and its relationship to logic. 

Finally, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is a possible category, as the paper discusses the use of language to describe programming language syntax and semantics.
